reviewText: This movie is (...) good! I LOVE it! It has it all! Yes it is in Japanese but they have words at the bottom of the screen so you know what their saying. What happens is Eli puts the whole city in darkness and everyone goes to sleep but not Li and Sakura. And Sakura must defeat Eli to save everyone. It even has Keroberos battle his greatest enemy! Spinel Sun a beast a lot like him only black with butterfly wings. And Yue battles his greatest enemy Ruby Moon. Sakura soon finds out she has to defeat Eli's evil spell. But when Keroberos and Yue tell her they must go into Sakura's staff for her to transform the Light and Dark card into Sakura cards when they do so Sakura uses the light card to defeat Eli and lift over the darkness and that's all for now. Watch to find out more!  And the opening song is HEAVENLY! I LOVE it!Do watch it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow, I can't believe I've been watching CCS for like 2 years, more actually.  It's been so long but now it's finally over.  I'm 18 but I still love this series, it has it's dull moments but brightens up a lot to.  And now the last disc of the series, but it wont be concluded till the 2nd movie which I should be getting today, yay!  But the last disc was great, emotional but too bad like some anime's get.  And the ending!  I just can't wait to get the 2nd movie and see the actual end.  BUt this disc was great, and of course if you've been watching CCS till now, you can't miss the end, duh!  So buy it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sakura finally gets to meet Clow Reed and he gives her unclear answers. Then Eriol confesses to be Clow Reed's reincarnation and then gives her the final task, to save her home town eternal darkness and it's people from eternal sleep. She then tries to change the last eight cards, but can only change six. Kero and Yue have to add there magic to Sakura's to change the light and dark cards, so light can chase away the darkness. Li then tells her that he like her and she is confused. In the end Li goes home to Hong Kong and Sakura creats a new Sakura card.

Title: N/A

reviewText: It should go without saying that this was a great ending to a great series. To be honest, I don't see much point in reviews for the final volume of such a long series... if you've made it this far, what's the chance you're not going to buy the last DVD?The main point of this review is to clarify something another reviewer said. Yes, it's true that if you go to Ebay you can get the whole series for a much lower price, but those will be bootleg DVDs. If you buy them you will not be supporting the creators of the series, also also the bootlegs are likely to have various video and subtitle issues.
Title: N/A
